summary: The APUS Orientation & Welcome Week is a two-day event designed to welcome new part-time undergraduate students. Activities include APUS 101, trivia sessions with prizes, tabling for information and merchandise, caricature drawings, and a Paint & Chill session. The event aims to help students connect with their elected representatives and each other while enjoying free food and drinks.
title: APUS Orientation & Welcome Week

summary: The Association of Part-time Undergraduate Students (APUS) is inviting part-time undergraduate students to join the student movement by volunteering. This initiative connects students locally, provincially, and nationally, encouraging them to challenge systems of oppression and get involved in meaningful change.

summary: The event highlights the successful advocacy efforts of students at the University of Toronto, showcasing various victories such as securing part-time student representation, eliminating out-of-province fees for Indigenous students, and implementing sexual violence prevention policies. It emphasizes the importance of student organizing and invites others to get involved in the movement.
title: Celebrating Student Advocacy Victories at UofT

summary: APUS is organizing a series of events aimed at connecting part-time undergraduate students across three campuses. summary: The Association of Part-Time Undergraduate Students (APUS) is dedicated to supporting part-time students in their educational journey through campaigns, services, and events. title: Launch of Slipp Condoms - Limited Edition

summary: The event focuses on exploring the Books of the Month at the Sexual Education Center, which address important topics such as consent and violence. The center offers various resources and peer support to promote safety and awareness during the critical first weeks of school.
title: Exploring Consent and Violence: Books of the Month at the Sexual Education Center

location: Waters Lounge (321 Bloor St W - Woodsworth Residence)
summary: Spicy Bingo is a sex-positive event aimed at educating participants about safe sex, gender, sexuality, consent, communication, STIs, and birth control in a fun atmosphere with prizes.
title: Spicy Bingo: A Fun and Informative Sex-Positive Event

summary: Celebrate the changing season with a chance to win a selection of sexy products including PinkCherry Cooling Arousal Balm, Goodhead Oral Delight Gel, Velvet Kiss Vibrator, and 7 Function Lover's Remote Bullet Vibe. Participants can enter by filling out a form and answering a trivia question. Winners will be notified on September 19 and must pick up their products by October 11.
title: September POTM: Fall to Your Knees

summary: This event is a virtual workshop titled 'The Queer and Trans Sex Ed You Should Have Gotten in High School' led by Eva Bloom. It aims to provide a shame-free, fun, and interactive space for queer and trans students to learn about communication frameworks, inclusive pleasure anatomy, and sexual health, while challenging cisheteronormative narratives.
title: Queer and Trans Sex Ed Workshop

summary: The PhySU Executive Office Hours provide an opportunity for students to resolve physics-related queries or engage in casual conversations with the executive team. These hours are available both in person and on Discord for the Fall 2024-25 academic year.
title: PhySU Executive Office Hours Kickoff

summary: An informational session for first-year students to apply for the position of First Year Representative for PHY151/2 & PHY131/2, hosted by Halle Nunes. Students can ask questions and get details about the application process.
title: First Year Rep Application Info Session

summary: This event features a talk by Vivek Dhande on the advancements in quantum computing hardware, focusing on two leading platforms: transmons & SQUIDs in superconducting quantum computing and quantum dots in semiconducting quantum computing. The discussion will include research on 3D integration of superconducting resonators and atomistic simulation of CMOS Si spin-qubit devices, as well as an overview of the global ecosystem supporting quantum computing advancements.
title: Advancements in Quantum Computing Hardware

summary: The 3rd Annual Quantum Student Conference and Q-SITE Hacks will take place, welcoming students from all academic backgrounds to participate in various activities and networking opportunities.
title: 3rd Annual Quantum Student Conference + Q-SITE Hacks

summary: An outdoor yoga event hosted by Miga Sears, a Uof T student and yoga instructor, aimed at enjoying the last days of summer. The event is fully booked.
title: Outdoor Yoga with Miga Sears

summary: The MMC is offering U of T students a $25 discount on any new student offer until the end of September, encouraging them to reset and reconnect between classes.
title: Back to School Offer: $25 Off for New Students

summary: Join Pair-A-Dice for its first meeting of the year at the COOP this Friday. It's a great opportunity to reconnect and have fun!
title: Pair-A-Dice Comeback Meeting

summary: The Pair-a-Dice club is introducing its executives for the 2024-2025 school year and inviting members to reach out for inquiries or to play board games. They are looking forward to the first meeting of the semester.
title: Meet the Pair-a-Dice Executives for 2024-2025

summary: Join Pair-A-Dice at the club fair at St Mikes to learn more about the club, chat, and ask questions.
title: Pair-A-Dice Club Fair at St Mikes

summary: The Latin Healthcare Event features a series of panels discussing social impacts on the Latin American community, with various experts sharing insights on health, food security, and public health issues. The event includes networking opportunities and a focus on providing vegan and halal food options.
title: Latin Healthcare Event: Social Impacts on the Latin American Community

summary: The LatinXcellence Symposium was an event aimed at connecting youth university students with seasoned professionals across various fields. It featured insightful conferences on topics such as Social Work, Climate Change, and Cancer treatments, fostering opportunities for learning and networking.
title: LatinXcellence Symposium: Connecting Youth and Professionals

summary: A convention for students featuring a 50% discount on entry. The event will include 8 hours of panels, workshops, conferences, and activities in Spanish, with 62 top speakers sharing valuable knowledge to inspire attendees in Canada.
title: Conexiones Latinas Student Convention

summary: The event celebrates the appointment of new team members, including a first-year representative, dance coordinator, academic assistants, and a social media assistant. The community expresses excitement for the upcoming semester and the achievements to come.
title: Welcome Ceremony for New Appointed Positions

summary: The LatinXcellence Event is designed to provide career support and networking opportunities for students after their undergraduate studies.
title: LatinXcellence Career Networking Event

summary: The LatinXcellence event focuses on mentorship and networking, providing attendees with career insights and support for their future aspirations.
title: LatinXcellence Networking Event

summary: The OLAS Soccer Intramural team is back and inviting everyone to join. No tryouts are needed, and players can sign up through the interest form linked in the bio. Games will be held on Saturday mornings.
title: Join the OLAS Soccer Intramural Team!

summary: The LatinXcellence - Nueva Generacion symposium is designed to empower and connect Latin American young professionals in Toronto through community engagement, workshops, panel discussions, and networking opportunities. The event focuses on skill-building and collaboration to inspire emerging professionals and equip them for success in their careers.
title: LatinXcellence: Nueva Generacion Symposium

summary: A Welcome Picnic event for new and returning students to enjoy the sun, make new friends, and celebrate the start of the semester with food and good vibes.
title: Welcome Picnic at Riverdale Park

location: New College and BIPOC Club Fairs, UTSU Clubs Carnival
summary: The Organization of Latin American Students (OLAS) participated in three club fairs this year, engaging with attendees and promoting their club.
title: OLAS Club Fair Participation

summary: Join NSBE for the Annual General Meeting to kick off the year with food, fun, and exciting prizes. Don't miss this informative evening!
title: NSBE Annual General Meeting

summary: The Welcome Event celebrated the start of the year with a dinner and a Varsity Blues football match, bringing together students from all three campuses for an evening of fun and camaraderie.
title: Welcome Event Celebration

location: Sir Daniel Wilson Quad (University College), Table #8, University of Toronto
summary: Join MusicBox at the Get Experience Fair to explore volunteer opportunities and learn more about the organization. Engage with executives and discover how you can contribute to a children's charity focused on music.
title: Get Experience Fair with MusicBox

summary: An information session to learn about MusicBox and meet the executive team.
title: MusicBox Info Session

summary: MusicBox is launching its 2024-2025 programming aimed at providing music education to children and families facing social or economic marginalization. The organization is seeking passionate volunteers to help nurture creativity and lead music programs.
title: Launch of MusicBox 2024-2025 Programming

summary: A reminder for applicants that there is one week left to submit their applications.
title: Application Deadline Reminder

summary: The motionball UofT 2025 committee is now accepting applications for various positions, including Recruitment Coordinator, Logistics Coordinator, and more. Interested individuals can apply through the link in the bio before the deadline.
title: motionball UofT 2025 Committee Applications Open

summary: A Meet & Greet event to kick off the school year, providing an opportunity to catch up and meet new friends while enjoying games and activities.
title: School Year Kick-Off Meet & Greet

summary: The event celebrates Hispanic Heritage Month, recognizing the contributions of Hispanic people throughout history and their impact on North American culture. The celebration includes weekly posts featuring interesting facts and highlighting Hispanic engineers.
title: Celebration of Hispanic Heritage Month

summary: An information session for international students to connect, share experiences, and receive advice about living in Canada.
title: International Students Information Session

summary: A pub crawl event featuring discounted specials at three bars in one night, with limited tickets available for purchase.
title: Huey at 110: Limited Tickets for Pub Crawl

location: Student Commons Room B120, 230 College St.
summary: An event where Googlers share their experiences and insights about being a software engineer at Google, providing a unique perspective on the engineering culture at the company.
title: Life of a Software Engineer: A Google Event

summary: The event commemorates the declaration of Brazil's independence from Portugal by Prince Dom Pedro I on September 7, 1822. This historic moment is marked by the famous cry of 'Independência ou Morte!' and led to the establishment of the Empire of Brazil.
title: Commemoration of Brazil's Independence Day

summary: KPE is launching its first mental health awareness club and is recruiting executive members. Applications are open until September 20th.
title: KPE Mental Health Awareness Club Recruitment

summary: The Italian Student Association's Language Café is a bi-weekly event where students can practice their Italian while enjoying espresso and socializing. The event takes place every other Wednesday at Kelly Library Café.
title: Italian Student Association Language Café

summary: The Italian Student Association is hosting a welcome event for the new academic year where attendees can meet friends and enjoy pizza.
title: Welcome Event by Italian Student Association

summary: Illuminaite UofT is a student-led club focused on making computer science and artificial intelligence accessible to everyone. They are currently hiring for various positions including Communications Director, Technical Director, and more. The club has hosted numerous events and aims to foster an inclusive community through workshops and mentorship programs.
title: Join the Illuminaite UofT Team!

summary: A free pre-med webinar hosted by Dr. Morty Razavi, aimed at providing insights into the medical school application process, understanding the MCAT, and offering tips to enhance applications. The event is designed for both new and prospective pre-med students.
title: Free Pre-Med Webinar: Your Path to Medical School

summary: The HBSU is inviting applications for Year Representative positions. Interested candidates can apply by the deadline of September 20, 2024, at 11:59 PM. The event encourages students to get involved in the executive team, with specific positions available for 1st, 2nd, and Upper Year Reps.
title: HBSU Year Representative Nominations Open

summary: Health Studies is offering a variety of opportunities for students, with sign-up and application deadlines approaching. Students are encouraged to check Instagram for more details.
title: Health Studies Opportunities for Students

summary: Health Perspectives is seeking to hire an editorial team for the 2024-2025 academic year, including positions for Senior Editors, Junior Editors, a Layout Editor, and a Director of Engagement. Interested students are encouraged to apply by the deadline.
title: Join the Health Perspectives Editorial Team!

summary: The Health Studies | Public Health Ambassador Program is being introduced for first-year students and others interested in getting involved in the community. Ambassadors will assist with event setup, outreach, and planning future events. Interested individuals can sign up via a link in the bio, with applications due by September 30th at 11:59 PM.
title: Launch of Health Studies | Public Health Ambassador Program

summary: The Health Studies Students’ Union is seeking candidates for eight positions on their Directionary Team, including representatives for each year and members at large. This is a great opportunity for students interested in gaining experience in executive roles.
title: Health Studies Students' Union Directionary Team Recruitment

summary: The Health Studies Students' Union is opening applications for their mentorship program for the 2024-2025 school year. First-year and second-year students are encouraged to apply for guidance in their program and career paths. Each mentee will be paired with an upper-year student and an alum from the Health Studies program.
title: Health Studies Mentorship Program Applications Open

summary: The 2024-2025 Health Studies Students’ Union executive team is introduced, highlighting their excitement to serve the student body and the supportive community within the Health Studies program.
title: Introducing the 2024-2025 Health Studies Students’ Union Executive Team

summary: The Public Health Orientation event is designed for new and prospective students to connect with peers and professors, learn about opportunities to get involved, and enjoy refreshments. Attendees will have the chance to meet members of the Health Studies Students’ Union and participate in fun activities.
title: Public Health Orientation 2024

summary: The Health Studies Students’ Union is hosting office hours where students can meet executive members, ask questions about the program, and connect with peers. Office hours will be available in-person and online on Tuesdays.
title: Health Studies Students' Union Office Hours

summary: GradSWE is hosting a series of 8 online information sessions to introduce new members to the Society of Women Engineers at the University of Toronto and discuss upcoming events and opportunities. Participants can sign up for a chance to win a $20 UofT Bookstore gift card.
title: GradSWE Online Info Sessions Kickoff

summary: An evening of gaming activities.
title: Wednesday Gaming Night

summary: Join us for a Jackbox Game Night featuring multiple games and prizes, alongside our regular board game night. No sign-up is needed; it's first come, first serve!
title: Jackbox Game Night at Wilson Hall

summary: A weekly board game night where participants can drop in to play various board games. Open to everyone, whether they are returning or new attendees.
title: Weekly Board Game Night

summary: An open house event for the European Affairs program, featuring presentations, pizza, and a prize raffle, providing an opportunity to learn more about the program and interact with professors and students.
title: European Affairs Open House

summary: The ESSA Journal, Messages in the Media, is seeking a new editor. Applications are due by September 30th at 11:59 PM.
title: Call for Editor: Messages in the Media Journal

summary: The event is an introduction to the CLF UofT executive team, highlighting their roles, programs of study, and fun facts about each member. It encourages interested individuals to join or stay informed about future events.
title: Meet the CLF UofT Executive Team

summary: The Concussion Legacy Foundation - University of Toronto Chapter participated in the UTSU Clubs Carnival, engaging with attendees and promoting their upcoming events and committee applications focused on concussion awareness.
